title: Covergirl: Supersizer
subtitle: WEBSITE
description: Working with art directors, I created an engaging landing page experience for a Covergirl campaign. The main UX challenge was using a different scroll direction without disrupting the user experience. I developed a solution that kept normal user scroll interactions the same, while creating a side scrolling parallax experience. This site was cross browser compatible with IE 8 and early mobile IOS and Android phones.

title: Porsche: Expedition Cayenne
subtitle: WEBSITE
description: This website was part of a campaign for the Porsche Cayenne in Latin America to help promote its versatility as not only a luxury car, but a sporty off-roading SUV.  I worked with art directors to help craft animations that showed off the Cayenneâ€™s progress traversing the length of South America and the car features that made it possible.  A major challenge for this website was updating the content of the site in almost real time, as soon as the drivers were able to upload images and videos from remote regions of their journey.

title: Captains For Clean Water: Our Fight
subtitle: WEBSITE
description: The goal of the Captains for Clean Water Our Fight page was to tell the story of their cause and the origin of their non-profit. I worked with the client and our art directors to make sure the animations helped support the story. An architectural problem I had to overcome was making sure the animations fit within a site builder template on mobile and desktop. This required making the Our Fight animations its own plugin and making sure the tempo was correct.

images.alt: Captains for Clean Water - Our Fight - website

title: Porsche: LATAM Dealer Landing Pages
subtitle: WEBSITE
description: We were tasked with creating campaign pages for 16 markets across LATAM. During this process, I worked closely with the Porshe CRM manager to integrate their CRM into the after sales pages for each market. The scale of the project and integration within a rigid website CMS proved to be the two biggest challenges of creating and maintaining these pages. I was able to overcome these challenges by creating a library of version-controlled templates separate from the Porshe CMS.

images.alt: Porsche: LATAM Dealer Landing Pages - After Sales- website
Porsche: LATAM Dealer Landing Pages - Macan - website
Porsche: LATAM Dealer Landing Pages - Taycan - website

title: Mercury: Repower
subtitle: HTML BANNERS
description: These banners were extremely fun to create. I used javascript and gsap to add subtle animations that helped highlight the Mercury Engines. The main challenge of these banners was keeping the same animation timing across all the different sizes.

title: Santa Margherita: Uncork Extraordinary
subtitle: HTML BANNERS
description: The challenge with these banners was matching up the animation with the main imagery for the campaign. I was able to simulate bubbles that behaved in a realistic manner using a pseudo random number generator in javascript and animations using gsap.

title: University of Miami Graduate Business School
subtitle: WEBSITE
description: The goal of this project was to capture qualified leads using 14 different landing pages targeting various graduate programs. My role was to develop the backend for the landing pages and the collection of qualified leads in a central database. I also was responsible for creating a data export for the University of Miami Sales team that they could integrate into their CRM platform.

images.alt: University of Miami Graduate Business School - website
University of Miami Graduate Business School DEAN - website
University of Miami Graduate Business School GEMBA - website

title: Porsche: Instagram AR Filter
subtitle: AR FILTER
description: This AR filter was created to get more social engagement for Porsche in the Jamaican market.   I developed it using Meta Spark for deployment on instagram.

title: Virgin Voyages: Launch Campaign
subtitle: HTML BANNERS
description: The main focus of these banners was to introduce the Virgin Voyages ship before it launched. This led to a technical challenge of using a flip book effect with the animation, while keeping the size small enough to still be usable on ad networks.
